subject: Design
title: Haptic Feedback: Feeling the Interface
description: Learn Haptic Feedback: Feeling the Interface in one minute.

hook.text: Your phone vibrates when you type. That tiny buzz is carefully designed to feel like a real button press.

buildup.text: Haptic feedback uses vibration motors to simulate texture, clicks, and resistance on flat glass screens.

discovery.text: Apple's Taptic Engine produces over 20 distinct vibration patterns for different interactions.

twist.text: Studies show haptic feedback reduces typing errors by 20%. Touch without feeling is guesswork.

climax.text: As screens replace physical controls in cars and appliances, haptics become a safety feature.

punchline.text: The best touchscreens don't just show â€” they feel.
